intro: Stigmatodon goniorachis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stigmatodon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces pale green to white flowers that are typically arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Stigmatodon goniorachis is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in shaded, forested areas.
